tool.name: viga
tool.command:
python $__tool_directory__/VIGA.py --input $input --diamonddb $diamonddb.fields.path --blastdb $blastdb.fields.path --rfamdb $rfamdb.fields.path --modifiers $modifiers --threads \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-5} --typedata $typedata_select --gcode $gcode_select --out "default" --minrepeat $minrepeat --maxrepeat $maxrepeat --minspacer $minspacer --maxspacer $maxspacer
#if $readlength --readlength $readlength #end if #if $windowsize --windowsize $windowsize #end if #if $slidingsize --slidingsize $slidingsize #end if #if $locus --locus $locus #end if #if $gffprint --gff #end if #if str($mincontigsize) --mincontigsize $mincontigsize #end if #if str($diamondevalue) --diamondevalue $blastevalue #end if #if str($diamondidthr) --diamondidthr $diamondidthr #end if #if str($diamondcoverthr) --diamondcoverthr $diamondcoverthr #end if #if $blastexh --blastexh #end if #if str($blastevalue) --blastevalue $blastevalue #end if #if str($blastidthr) --blastidthr $blastidthr #end if #if str($cblastoverthr) --blastcoverthr $blastcoverthr #end if #if str($hmmsearch.use_hmmer) == "yes": --hmmerdb $hmmsearch.hmmdb.fields.path --hmmerevalue $hmmsearch.hmmerevalue --hmmeridthr $hmmsearch.hmmeridthr --hmmercoverthr $hmmsearch.hmmercoverthr #else --nohmmer #end if

param.name: input
param.label: (Viral) contigs to annotate
param.help: Input file as a FASTA file. It can contain multiple sequences (e.g. metagenomic contigs)

param.name: rfamdb
param.label: RFAM database used for ribosomal RNA prediction

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: modifiers
param.label: Metadata of the contigs
param.help: Modifiers per every FASTA header according to SeqIn (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Sequin/modifiers.html)

param.name: gcode_select
param.label: Number of GenBank translation table (--gcode)
param.option: Ciliate, dasycladacean and hexamita nuclear code

param.name: mincontigsize
param.label: Minimum contig length to be considered in the output

param.name: readlength
param.label: Read length (--readlength)
param.help: Read length for the circularity prediction

param.name: windowsize
param.label: Window size (--windowsize)
param.help: Window size used to determine the origin of replication in circular contigs according to the cumulative GC skew

param.name: slidingsize
param.label: sliding window size (--slidingsize)
param.help: Sliding window size for the origin of replication prediction

param.name: locus
param.label: Locus tag prefix (--locustag)
param.help: Name of the sequences. If the input is a multifasta file, please put a general name

param.name: gffprint
param.label: Print the output also as GFF3 file
param.help: Printing the output as GFF3 file (Default: FALSE)

param.name: minrepeat
param.label: Minimum repeat length for CRISPR detection (--minrepeat)

param.name: maxrepeat
param.label: Maximum repeat length for CRISPR detection (--maxrepeat)

param.name: minspacer
param.label: Minimum spacer length for CRISPR detection (--minspacer)

param.name: maxspacer
param.label: Maximum spacer length for CRISPR detection (--maxspacer)

param.name: diamonddb
param.label: DIAMOND database
param.help: DIAMOND Protein Database that will be used for the protein function prediction

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: blastdb
param.label: BLAST Database
param.help: BLAST Protein Database that will be used for the protein function prediction

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: blastexh
param.label: Use exhaustive BLAST (--blastexh)
param.help: Use of exhaustive BLAST to predict the proteins by homology according to Fozo et al. (2010) Nucleic Acids Res (Default=FALSE)

param.name: use_hmmer
param.label: Use HMMER to predict protein function using HMM

param.name: hmmdb
param.label: HMMER database to use for protein function prediction

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

tool.help:
**About VIGA**
VIGA_ is a script written in Python 2.7 that annotates viral genomes automatically (using a de novo algorithm) and predict the function of their proteins using BLAST and HMMER.
----
**About this Galaxy wrapper**
**Requirements**
`Docker <https://www.docker.com>`_ should first be installed and working on the server where this Galaxy instance is setup. The user running Galaxy should be part of the **docker** user group.
#. Download or clone the VIGA_ Github repository (as a submodule) in to the ``tools`` directory.
**Configuration**
**Update database paths in .loc files**
Edit the following files in the **tool-data** directory and add paths to corresponding databases:
* viga_blastdb.loc * viga_diamonddb.loc * viga_rfamdb.loc * viga_hmmdb.loc
**Create or update the Galaxy job configuration file**
If the file **config/job_conf.xml** does not exist, create it by copying the template **config/job_conf.xml.sample_basic** in the Galaxy directory. Then add a Docker destination for viga. Change ``/data/databases`` under ``docker_volumes`` to the location where your databases are stored. Here is an example::
<?xml version="1.0"?> <!-- A sample job config that explicitly configures job running the way it is configured by default (if there is no explicit config). --> <job_conf> <plugins> <plugin id="local" type="runner" load="galaxy.jobs.runners.local:LocalJobRunner" workers="4"/> </plugins> <handlers> <handler id="main"/> </handlers> <destinations default="local"> <destination id="local" runner="local"/> <destination id="docker" runner="local"> <param id="docker_enabled">true</param> <param id="docker_sudo">false</param> <param id="docker_auto_rm">true</param> <param id="docker_volumes">$defaults,/data/databases:ro</param> </destination> </destinations> <tools> <tool id="viga" destination="docker"/> </tools> </job_conf>
**Restart Galaxy**. The tool will now be ready to use.
----
**Output files**
VIGA creates the following output files:
* tbl - Table file with all protein information. * gbk - GenBank format file with annotations. * fasta - FASTA format file for GenBank submission * csv - Table file for GenBank submission. * gff - GFF3 format file (if option is selected)
